rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
[[File:Warburg Dillon Read.png|thumb|240px|right|Warburg Dillon Read (originally SBC-Warburg Dillon Read) was the brand used for the Investment Banking division of [[Swiss Bank Corporation]] and later UBS from 1997-1999]]
  â  
'''Warburg Dillon Read''' was an [[investment bank]] created by the [[Swiss Bank Corporation]] ("SBC"), following its 1997 acquisition of [[S. G. Warburg & Co.]] which it merged with [[Dillon, Read & Co.]], a firm it had acquired in 1995. SBC itself merged with the [[Union Bank of Switzerland]] in 1998, creating [[UBS AG]]. Warburg Dillon Read was subsequently renamed [[UBS Warburg]] and eventually just '''UBS'''.
'''Warburg Dillon Read''' was an [[investment bank]] created by the [[Swiss Bank Corporation]] ("SBC"), following its 1997 acquisition of [[S. G. Warburg & Co.]] which it merged with [[Dillon, Read & Co.]], a firm it had acquired in 1995. SBC itself merged with the [[Union Bank of Switzerland]] in 1998, creating [[UBS AG]]. Warburg Dillon Read was subsequently renamed [[UBS Warburg]] and eventually just '''UBS'''.
